programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Pirates (1-4, 0-1 American) try to get their offense in gear when they play the Mustangs (3-2, 1-0). East Carolina's Alex Flinn has thrown for one total touchdown in five games this season. ECU won the most recent meeting with SMU, 52-38 in 2020.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.desc: The Pirates (1-4, 0-1 American) try to get their offense in gear when they play the Mustangs (3-2, 1-0). East Carolina's Alex Flinn has thrown for one total touchdown in five games this season. ECU won the most recent meeting with SMU, 52-38 in 2020.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Tigers (4-1, 1-0 American) and Green Wave (4-1, 1-0) battle in Tennessee. The schools have traded wins over the last six seasons, with Tulane taking a 38-28 victory in 2022. Michael Pratt (TULN) threw for a TD and rushed for another in that game.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Shedeur Sanders and the Buffaloes host the Cardinal for a Pac-12 game. Colorado comes off its first conference victory under coach Deion Sanders, 27-24 at Arizona State. Shedeur Sanders, Coach Prime's son, leads the nation with 2,020 passing yards.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Razorbacks seek an upset victory over the No. 11 Crimson Tide. Jalen Milroe passed for three touchdowns as Alabama escaped Texas A&M with a 26-20 triumph on Oct. 7. Arkansas has dropped four straight overall, and 16 in a row to Alabama.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: A new Big 12 rivalry is formed as the Cougars (4-1, 1-1) and Horned Frogs (3-3, 1-2) meet for the first time since 2011. BYU comes off its first Big 12 triumph, 35-27 over Cincinnati. TCU's Emani Bailey, a 5-foot-9 junior, has rushed for 690 yards.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: A battle of Tigers pits Auburn (3-2, 0-2 SEC) against No. 22 LSU (4-2, 3-1) from Death Valley. LSU survived a fight with then-No. 21 Missouri on Oct. 7, jumping one spot in the Top 25. In 2022, LSU beat Auburn 21-17 despite only passing for 85 yards.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From Fort Bend Epicenter in Rosenberg, Texas.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: A battle of Tigers pits Auburn (3-2, 0-2 SEC) against No. 22 LSU (4-2, 3-1) from Death Valley. LSU survived a fight with then-No. 21 Missouri on Oct. 7, jumping one spot in the Top 25. In 2022, LSU beat Auburn 21-17 despite only passing for 85 yards.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: Women's College Volleyball
programme.desc: From Fertitta Center in Houston.

programme.title: Boy's High School Basketball
programme.desc: Action from boys high school basketball.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: Pickleball
programme.desc: Action from the paddle sport.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: From Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Benedict and Fort Valley State both have a lot on the line when they tangle in this SIAC matchup. The Tigers (6-0, 4-0 SIAC) thrashed the Wildcats (5-1, 5-0) 45-13 in last year's game, but FVS owns a 10-4 all-time edge.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: ESPN's morning sports magazine show, featuring the biggest names and stories in sports.

programme.title: The Gentleman Boxer: Richard Torrez Jr.
programme.desc: A profile of American Olympic silver medalist Richard Torrez Jr., a multi-faceted boxer and man.

programme.title: One More Round: Fury vs. Wilder 3
programme.desc: Another look at the classic third fight between Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder. From Oct. 9, 2021.

programme.desc: Vegas odds don't always tell the full story. Three impressive UFC performances that show just how much bite an underdog can have. With Scoggins vs Sasaki, Perry vs Griffin, and Rousey vs Holm.

programme.title: Fantasy Focus
programme.desc: Field Yates hosts ESPN's top Fantasy Football experts for a daily discussion of rankings, injuries and game previews and debate how the biggest NFL stories impact Fantasy Football.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.desc: Exclusive takes on the biggest news, stars, and stories from UFC.

programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The undefeated Dukes (5-0, 2-0 Sun Belt) defend their perch against the Eagles (4-1, 1-0). Last season, in the first meeting between the schools, Georgia Southern got a late touchdown catch from Derwin Burgess Jr. to upend James Madison 45-38.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: A Sunshine State showdown sees the Owls visit the Bulls. Florida Atlantic performed admirably in its American Athletic Conference debut Oct. 7, taking down Tulsa 20-17. Byrum Brown has accounted for 18 of South Florida's 24 total touchdowns in 2023.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Marshall stays on the road for a game against Georgia State. Both clubs had four-game win streaks, and perfect seasons, spoiled in their most recent outing. The Thundering Herd ran over the Panthers 28-23 during their first Sun Belt campaign in 2022.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Idaho plays only its second home date of the season when they clash with Montana for the Little Brown Stein. In 2022, the Vandals beat the Grizzlies 30-23 to take back the Stein after it spent seven years in Missoula, Mont. Both clubs are 5-1.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: Former lightweight champion Frankie Edgar faces Brazilian featherweight submission ace Charles Oliveira. See how these two iron-willed ground specialists made their ways to the big show on UFC Main Event: Edgar vs. Oliveira.

programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: CrossFit Games: Finding the Fittest
programme.desc: Athletes perform at the limits of human capacity to be crowned the Fittest Man and Woman on Earth.

programme.title: CrossFit Games: Finding the Fittest
programme.desc: Athletes perform at the limits of human capacity to be crowned the Fittest Man and Woman on Earth.

programme.title: Red Bull Signature Series
programme.desc: The most progressive and innovative snowboarding, mountain biking, ice cross events and more.

programme.title: Boy's High School Basketball
programme.desc: Action from boys high school basketball.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Mountaineers and Cougars do battle for the first time. West Virginia has remained unbeaten since a season-opening loss to then-No. 7 Penn State, with quarterback Garrett Greene rushing for two touchdowns in a 24-21 win over TCU on Sept. 30.

programme.title: Big Noon Kickoff

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cyclones square off against the Bearcats for the first time. Iowa State returned to the win column by recording four interceptions in a 27-14 decision versus TCU on Oct. 7. Cincinnati returns from its bye week looking to end a three-game slide.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 23 Jayhawks try to make it two straight over the Cowboys in a Big 12 game. Kansas snapped a 12-game series slide with a 37-16 victory in 2022. Kansas bounced back from its only loss of the season with a 51-22 romp over UCF in Week 6.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Wildcats try to keep piling on the Red Raiders. Kansas State beat Texas Tech 37-28 last season for a seventh consecutive series victory. Tahj Brooks turned 31 carries into 170 yards and a touchdown during Texas Tech's win over Baylor on Oct. 7.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Ashton Jeanty and the Broncos visit the Rams for a Mountain West contest. Boise State has won all 12 meetings with Colorado State. Jeanty, a 5-foot-9 sophomore, leads the MWC in rushing yards (656) and touchdowns with 12, four receiving.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 2 Wolverines try to continue their mastery of the Hoosiers in a Big Ten game. Michigan leads the series 61-10 after winning the last two meetings. The Wolverines have won their last 22 regular-season contests.

programme.title: The Perfect 10
programme.desc: The 10 legendary football icons who have achieved one of the rarest dual accomplishments -- winning the coveted Heisman Trophy and being enshrined in the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Red-hot Big Ten squads meet at Camp Randall as Wisconsin plays Iowa. The Badgers have won three straight, while the Hawkeyes are 2-0 since Deacon Hill replaced Cade McNamara as the starting quarterback on Sept. 30. Iowa beat Wisconsin 24-10 in 2022.
